intro: Kajewskiella trichantha, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
